list_definition.definition: something a person enjoys doing (usually frequently) in his/her spare time and not for pay

list_ex_of_english: They neglected their homework and had no hobbies.
In lines 23 -30, he explains his entrance into the field of electronics through an account of personal hobbies and friendships.
People live active lives far beyond retirement; our families, friends, hobbies, and sometimes professional careers, too, continue to make our lives worthwhile.
Gardening, too, was a favourite hobby, but neither swimming nor bicycling were as popular as might be expected.
Similarly, friends may call or special hobbies may be taken up which will compensate for the loss of stimulation.
The health effects of solitary leisure activities, such as mainly home-based hobbies or watching television, are however inconclusive.
The decrease in hobby activities was only seen among women.
How long have you had this hobby for?
